posts.name: Erik
posts.cooked:
We had a CANcoder get busted this past weekend at a District event.  CTR’s analysis was that it got hit hard enough to break it…of course it was sitting on top of our WCP X2i corner swerve modules. We had an opposing team “go to max speed” (their team’s words) on their swerve and hit us over and over, damaging other parts of our robot in addition to this during the semifinal competition.

Open to any opinions on how to protect ourselves better. Also as to whether this could be caused by the team ramming us or a stray coral hitting us in the exact wrong place?

image 1062×967 87.9 KB

image 1062×967 87.9 KB

image 1062×967 87.9 KB

posts.name: Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons
posts.cooked:
We initially were going to protect our Cancoders with ABS printed parts mounted to each corner of both bumpers.  THEN we saw the damage that can be done with a coral impact with carpet.

We covered all open areas with Lexan/polycarb.  They effectively covered all corners of our swerve modules…especially our Cancoders. IMG_4249 2 1920×2560 710 KB

IMG_4249 2 1920×2560 710 KB

IMG_4249 2 1920×2560 710 KB

Note the clear areas…we painted the rest black for stickers.  We had clear visual access to the status of the cancoders.

We were hit multiple times…at high speed…with no damage to them.  Something must have entered that corner.

I hope they replaced that encoder…and were heavily penalized for the intentional damage done.
posts.display_username: Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons

posts.name: Layton
posts.cooked:
We have 3d printed covers to keep stuff out and protect ours

Also I hope they offered to replace that especially since it seemed like it was intentional and were trying to break stuff

posts.name: philso
posts.cooked: Last season, we used swerve protectors that were pretty effective. We bent pieces of 1/8" polycarb 90 degrees. They were installed on the outside of the frame tubes and swerve modules. They extended at least an inch over the tallest part of the swerve modules (the CANcoder) and extended on each side far enough to attach to the frame tubes. This season, one would want protection from falling Coral on top.

posts.name: JBENJI
posts.cooked:
Hmm - not sure if these would even remotely work for a WCP swerve module but we use these on our SDS swerve - if not, it might at least give you an idea on what you might be able to cut out yourself?

Encoder Guard Plate for use on the MK4i swerve module. Weight: 0.01 Pounds Material: 7075-T6 Aluminum Finish: As Machined

Price: USD 5.00

posts.name: Justin Buist
posts.cooked: We 3d print a cover for ours. With an optional camera mount on it. Kind of a nice place to stick a camera.
